12.6.24  12:17 pm   I saw this form of musical notation in a question asked to you on August 14, 2018: "3/4

3..45./2...../1..23./lo7...../lo6.lo7.1./lo5...3./4..321/2...../
3..45./2...../1..23./lo7...3./4.3.1./1...lo7./1.1235/8.1.../"; you mentioned in your answer that this is a form of notation you use as well when you only have access to text to write music.
It looks interesting and efficient, but I can't make heads or tails of it. Would you mind explaining this form of notation, to a musician-in-training who's used to standard music notation?
